meanings.definition: A person who perceives or is capable of perceiving.
meanings.sent1: The perceivers in the room noticed the subtle changes in the painting.
meanings.sent2: The group of perceivers quickly understood the complex instructions.
meanings.sent3: The perceivers at the magic show were amazed by the tricks.
meanings.sent4: She was a perceiver of emotions, able to sense people's feelings effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The perceivers in the dark could hear the faint sound of footsteps approaching.

meanings.definition: Those who are able to understand or interpret something.
meanings.sent1: The perceivers in the class grasped the concept easily.
meanings.sent2: As experienced perceivers, they could see through the deception.
meanings.sent3: The perceivers at the comedy show laughed at all the jokes.
meanings.sent4: He was a perceiver of truth, always seeking to uncover hidden meanings.
meanings.sent5: The perceivers in the crowd could predict the outcome of the game.
